image.alt: Smiling patients and orthodontic team at Tyska Alexander Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Having a beautiful smile increases your self‑esteem and the confidence with which you move through the world. Dr. Edwin Tyska and Dr. Kristen Alexander excel at creating incredible smiles that are healthy and becoming. Our doctors consult together when designing treatment plans so you benefit from multiple experienced specialists and a customized approach.

We have an experienced, compassionate team who will be by your side throughout care. From the first consultation through retention, we focus on clear communication, modern techniques, and a comfortable experience for patients of all ages.

items.title: Collaborative Care
items.text: Treatment plans are developed with input from multiple experienced orthodontists, giving each patient the benefit of several specialists’ perspectives.

items.title: Customized Plans
items.text: Every treatment plan is tailored to the patient’s needs, focusing on long‑term health and results that fit your lifestyle.

items.title: Advanced Technology
items.text: We use digital scanning and modern tools, and the doctors pursue ongoing education to expand treatment options and improve comfort.

items.title: Friendly Team
items.text: Our patient‑focused staff provides compassionate support and clear guidance through every step of treatment.

paragraphs.text: Edwin L. Tyska, DDS, enjoys orthodontics and serving patients in the Buffalo area. He emphasizes treating every patient as he would his own family and stays current through continuing education to deliver thoughtful, effective care.

image.alt: Dr. Edwin Tyska, orthodontist at Tyska Alexander Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Kristen M. Alexander, DDS, is a Buffalo native who brings a commitment to continuing education and the latest treatment options. She focuses on clear communication and delivering strong, lasting results for patients of all ages.

image.alt: Dr. Kristen Alexander, orthodontist at Tyska Alexander Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: We offer a full range of orthodontic services, from discreet clear aligners to fixed braces and retainers, plus digital scanning for a comfortable, accurate fit.

image.alt: Patient holding Invisalign aligners
Patient smiling with ceramic braces
Various orthodontic retainers displayed
Digital scanning equipment used for orthodontic impressions
Parents with kids relaxing in front of home
Enjoying time together

og_meta.title: Home - Tyska Alexander Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Personalized orthodontic care in Clarence and Tonawanda, NY — Invisalign®, braces, retainers, and modern digital scanning.

image.alt: Team of orthodontic professionals smiling in the office lobby

paragraphs.text: We recognize that all of our patients are unique and deserve to receive orthodontic care that reflects their individual needs. Our experienced and talented team is committed to working with you and your family to create a comfortable, stress‑free, and rewarding orthodontic experience every time you visit our practice. We are pleased to welcome you and your family, and we look forward to working with you.

Having a beautiful smile increases your self‑esteem and the confidence with which you move through the world. Our doctors consult together when they design a treatment plan for each patient, so you benefit from multiple specialists collaborating on one customized plan tailored to your needs. With individualized attention to detail, our goal is to make your mouth healthy and your smile beautiful.

image.alt: Dr. Edwin L. Tyska

paragraphs.text: Following his postgraduate studies, Dr. Edwin L. Tyska began his career in private practice and later became a partner. He brings long‑standing clinical experience and a collaborative approach to each treatment plan.

image.alt: Dr. Edwin L. Tyska in clinic

paragraphs.text: Dr. Tyska and the doctors in the practice regularly participate in continuing education programs to stay current with treatment methods, materials, and the latest technology.

image.alt: Dr. Tyska at a continuing education event

paragraphs.text: A resident of East Amherst, Dr. Tyska is active with family life, coaches the Lou Gehrig Lasers travel girls’ softball league, enjoys golf, travel, and supporting the Buffalo Sabres.

image.alt: Dr. Tyska supporting local youth sports
Dr. Kristen M. Alexander

paragraphs.text: Dr. Kristen M. Alexander maintains an active clinical practice and brings a patient‑centered approach to treatment, focusing on clear communication and individualized care.

image.alt: Dr. Kristen M. Alexander in clinic

paragraphs.text: Dr. Alexander regularly participates in continuing education and maintains professional affiliations with local and national dental and orthodontic organizations to ensure patients benefit from current best practices.

image.alt: Professional affiliations

paragraphs.text: A Buffalo native, Dr. Alexander lives locally with her husband and children. She enjoys outdoor activities, travel, and cheering for local sports teams.

image.alt: Dr. Alexander with family

og_meta.title: About Us | Tyska & Alexander Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Meet our doctors and team serving Clarence and Tonawanda with modern, compassionate orthodontic care.

image.alt: Smiling family welcomed at Tyska Alexander Orthodontics front desk

paragraphs.text: Your initial consultation is where we learn about your concerns and evaluate your smile. You’ll meet our team and the doctor, we’ll review your dental and medical history, and perform a thorough oral exam to determine whether orthodontic treatment is recommended and which options may be right for you.

We’ll help you build a customized treatment plan and walk through financial options, insurance details, and payment plans. Please bring completed patient forms or plan to fill them out electronically, a photo ID, any insurance cards, and a list of current medications.

image.alt: Father with daughter at reception of dentist's surgery

paragraphs.text: We accept most major credit cards and can assist with insurance claims when orthodontic benefits apply, helping to reduce paperwork for you.

Flexible financing and in-house payment plans are available to fit different budgets. Complimentary consultations are offered so you can meet our team, have photos taken, and review your treatment plan.
Complete forms online through our patient portal, or download and print the appropriate health history PDFs before your visit. If you have trouble opening PDFs, Adobe Reader is available for free.

image.alt: Patient filling out orthodontic health history forms online
Enjoying time together

seo.page_description: Start your orthodontic journey: learn what to expect at your first visit, access patient forms, review payment options, and book a free consultation.
seo.page_keywords: orthodontics, new patient, patient forms, financing, consultation, TA Orthodontics

og_meta.title: Get Started | TA Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Start your orthodontic journey: learn what to expect at your first visit, access patient forms, review payment options, and book a free consultation.

image.alt: Orthodontic treatment overview with smiling patients in a bright clinic

paragraphs.text: Early treatment, often called Phase One, typically begins around age eight to nine with follow-up Phase Two around age 11 and up. The goal is to guide jaw growth, correct bite issues early, and make room for permanent teeth so later treatment can be simpler and shorter.

accordion.header: When to start

paragraphs.text: The American Association of Orthodontists recommends an evaluation by age seven. We look for signs that early care could help, including crowding, crossbites, or a pronounced underbite.

image.alt: Young patient receiving early orthodontic treatment

accordion.header: What it corrects

paragraphs.text: Early care can guide jaw growth, address crossbites, severe crowding, protruding teeth and space issues, and reduce problems caused by prolonged thumb sucking.

image.alt: Orthodontist consulting with a child and parent about early treatment

accordion.header: Benefits

paragraphs.text: Starting early can reduce the need for extractions or jaw surgery later, create space for permanent teeth, shorten future treatment time, and improve function like chewing and speech sooner.

image.alt: Smiling child after early orthodontic treatment
Child receiving orthodontic evaluation in a modern clinic

Treatments.title: Adult orthodontic options — It’s never too late

paragraphs.text: Many adults are excellent candidates for orthodontic care. Modern techniques offer discreet options that fit adult lifestyles while improving function, hygiene, and smile appearance.

accordion.header: Discreet options

paragraphs.text: We offer clear aligners like Invisalign<sup>®</sup>, ceramic (clear) braces, and lower-profile metal braces with smaller brackets. For minor tooth movement, retainers can sometimes correct small concerns.

image.alt: Adult patient smiling after orthodontic treatment

accordion.header: Expectations and coordination

paragraphs.text: Adult treatment times vary and may require coordination with periodontal care, restorative work, or, rarely, surgery. We plan treatments to minimize disruption and protect oral health.

image.alt: Orthodontist reviewing adult treatment options with patient
Adult patient consulting about orthodontic options

accordion.header: Traditional Metal Braces

paragraphs.text: Metal brackets bonded to the teeth use archwires to apply gentle, continuous force and move teeth into place. They are durable and effective for a wide range of problems.

image.alt: Patient with traditional metal braces

accordion.header: Ceramic Braces

paragraphs.text: Ceramic brackets blend with tooth color for a less noticeable option while providing effective tooth movement. They may require extra attention to hygiene and care.

image.alt: Close-up of ceramic braces on teeth
Two smiling teens showing braces

paragraphs.text: Invisalign<sup>®</sup> uses advanced 3D imaging and a series of custom clear aligners to move teeth incrementally. Aligners are removable for eating and hygiene, and treatment is planned and previewed digitally.

Candidates include people with crowding, spacing, and many bite issues. Appointments are often less frequent and the aligners use SmartTrack material and SmartForce features to maintain precise control of movement.

image.alt: Close-up of clear Invisalign aligner on teeth

paragraphs.text: Orthognathic surgery may be recommended for significant jaw discrepancies where tooth movement alone cannot achieve a stable, functional bite. Adults with skeletal malocclusions sometimes need combined surgical and orthodontic care.

The process includes comprehensive evaluation and imaging, pre-surgical orthodontics to align the teeth, coordinated surgery with an oral and maxillofacial surgeon, and post-surgical orthodontics to finalize the bite.

image.alt: Orthodontic team reviewing surgical planning images

paragraphs.text: After active treatment, retainers preserve alignment. We provide removable Essix-style retainers, traditional acrylic-and-wire retainers, and fixed bonded retainers depending on your needs.
Wear schedules vary by case: often full-time initially, then nightly. Good oral hygiene, regular dental cleanings, and following retainer instructions are essential to protect your investment.

image.alt: Patient holding a clear retainer

paragraphs.text: We use digital tools like iTero scanners, 3D treatment planning, and digital X-rays to improve precision and comfort. Digital scans replace messy impressions and help visualize your treatment outcome.

accordion.header: iTero digital scanning

paragraphs.text: Fast, radiation-free scans capture accurate 3D images for aligners and treatment planning.

image.alt: Digital intraoral scanner in use

accordion.header: 3D treatment planning

paragraphs.text: Advanced software simulates each stage of tooth movement so you can preview results before treatment begins.

image.alt: 3D orthodontic treatment planning on a computer screen

accordion.header: Digital X-rays

paragraphs.text: High-resolution digital radiography and 3D imaging support accurate diagnosis while minimizing radiation exposure.

image.alt: Digital X-ray equipment used in orthodontic diagnosis
Modern orthodontic technology and equipment in a treatment room
Enjoying time together

og_meta.title: Contact Tyska Alexander Orthodontics | Clarence & Tonawanda Orthodontist
og_meta.description: Contact Tyska Alexander Orthodontics in Clarence and Tonawanda. Call (716) 759-8323, email info@taortho.com, or request an appointment online.

image.alt: Patient speaking with front desk about appointments in a bright orthodontic office

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about orthodontic treatments, Invisalign<sup>®</sup>, appointment scheduling, patient forms, and payment options at Tyska Alexander Orthodontics.

accordion.header: What treatment options do you offer?

paragraphs.text: We offer a full range of orthodontic options including traditional metal braces, ceramic (clear) braces, Invisalign<sup>®</sup> clear aligners, retainers for minor movement, palatal expanders and other appliances. Your doctor will review options and recommend the best approach for your needs.

image.alt: Orthodontic consultation and treatment planning in a modern office

accordion.header: How does Invisalign work and how long does it take?

paragraphs.text: Invisalign<sup>®</sup> uses a series of clear, removable aligner trays made from SmartTrack material. A custom digital plan maps tooth movement; aligners are usually worn about 20–22 hours per day and checkups are typically every six weeks. Treatment length varies by case.

image.alt: Clear aligners on a model showing staged tooth movement

accordion.header: How long will orthodontic treatment take?

paragraphs.text: Treatment times vary by age, method and case severity. Typical ranges are about 1–3 years; early (interceptive) treatment for children can shorten overall time. Your doctor will estimate your treatment length during the consultation.

image.alt: Orthodontic treatment timeline explanation during a consultation

accordion.header: Do you offer surgical orthodontics if needed?

paragraphs.text: For adults with severe jaw discrepancies we coordinate orthognathic (jaw) surgery with an oral/maxillofacial surgeon. Braces are used before and after surgery to finalize the bite; we will discuss risks, recovery time and expected steps if surgery is recommended.

image.alt: Orthodontist reviewing surgical treatment coordination with a patient

accordion.header: What do I need to know about visiting the dentist while in orthodontic care?

paragraphs.text: Continue visiting your family dentist every six months for cleanings and routine care while in orthodontic treatment. If extra dental work is needed, our offices will coordinate timing and care with your family dentist.

image.alt: Orthodontic team coordinating care with a family dentist

accordion.header: How often will I have appointments during treatment?

paragraphs.text: Routine orthodontic follow-ups are usually scheduled about every 4–8 weeks, depending on the appliance and stage of treatment.

image.alt: Patient returning for a routine orthodontic adjustment

accordion.header: What are the basic care instructions (brushing, flossing, appliance care)?

paragraphs.text: Brush and floss carefully after meals. For braces use floss threaders or orthodontic floss; consider a water flosser if needed. For loose wires or irritation use orthodontic wax or rinse with warm salt water and contact the office for advice. For aligners, wear them 20–22 hours/day and remove only for eating and oral hygiene.

image.alt: Brushing and flossing with braces

accordion.header: What happens after my initial consultation?

paragraphs.text: After your consultation we’ll schedule your first appliance placement visit. The placement appointment typically takes about an hour. The doctor and team will be available to ensure your comfort.

image.alt: Orthodontic team preparing a patient for appliance placement

accordion.header: What payment and insurance options do you accept?

paragraphs.text: Treatment cost depends on your individualized plan. The practice accepts most major credit cards and many insurance plans, and offers in‑house financing and low monthly payment plans. Office staff will help with insurance claims and paperwork.

image.alt: Front desk staff helping a patient with insurance and payment options

accordion.header: How can I schedule an appointment?

paragraphs.text: You can call either office or request an appointment online. Phone (Clarence office): (716) 759-8323. Phone (Tonawanda office): (716) 875-0405. Appointment request (online form): https://www.taortho.com/appointment-request.

image.alt: Patient calling to schedule an orthodontic appointment

accordion.header: Where can I fill out new‑patient forms?

paragraphs.text:
Patients can fill forms electronically here: https://patient.sesamecommunications.com/mandtortho/index.html. Printable PDFs (child and adult health history) are also available:
Child Patient Form (PDF): https://www.taortho.com/hub_sites/macdonald-andrew2/www/assets/uploads/files/health%20history(2).pdf
Adult Patient Form (PDF): https://www.taortho.com/hub_sites/macdonald-andrew2/www/assets/uploads/files/health%20history(3).pdf

image.alt: Patient completing new patient forms on a tablet
Enjoying time together
